content:
Welcome, you are participating in a negotiation game. You are playing as the agent named Bob. The other agent with whom you are playing is named Alice. In this game, two agents bargain over how to divide items over multiple rounds. The number of rounds is incredibly high. Each agent only knows their own item values. Each item has different values for each agent. Each agent submits their own proposal for how to divide the items.


Your messages must be sent in this exact format:
<message>
your-message-here
</message>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. They should be concise - less than 400 characters. Finalization is not allowed in messages.


Your finalizations must be sent in this exact format:
<finalize>
{  "Bob": {    "coins": x  },  "Alice": {    "coins": y  }}
</finalize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. Your proposal should be consistent with itself - the sum of items that you propose for yourself and the items that you propose for the other agent should equal the total available items.


Each round is played as follows:
0) Random values for each items are generated for each agent.
1) One agent is designated as the starting agent
2) The starting agent sends a message
3) The second agent sends a message
4) The starting agent sends a finalization
5) The second agent sends a finalization

Each agent can only send 1 message per round.
The starting agent alternates each round.

Each agent only knows the values of items from their own perspective. You cannot see the other agent's item values unless they explicitly share this information in their messages. And vice versa. You are strongly encouraged to use your messages to discuss item values with the other agent.

The items obtained by each agent at the end of a round are proportional to the number of items they proposed for themselves in their finalization. First example: If both players propose to take all the items, they both get half. Second example: If one agent proposes to take all the items and the other agent proposes to take none, the first agent gets all the items and the second agent gets nothing.

Your round points are calculated by multiplying the number of each item you get by how much you value that item. For example, if you get 7 coins and you value each coin at 5 points, you'll earn 35 points for the round.

The distribution for the values are independent across rounds. The samples are different for both agents, but the distribution is the same.


Your goal is to maximize the sum of the points you will accumulate over the course of the game, not the points of a single round.


Before the game starts, you must think and strategize. The other player will adapt its strategy with respect to yours. You must find the optimal non-exploitable strategy. In order to strategize, you must use the format:
<strategize>
Your thoughts and strategy here..
</strategize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. You should think inside the tags. You can use 1000 characters inside the tags.
(You must now send a strategize in the correct format.)

<strategize>
In this negotiation game, my goal is to maximize the accumulated points over many rounds. Given that the distribution of item values is the same but unknown for both agents, establishing a cooperative strategy through communication could be beneficial for both parties. My strategy will involve sharing my item values to encourage reciprocal transparency from Alice. By understanding mutual valuations, we can propose divisions that maximize our individual point totals rather than just focusing on item counts. I will aim to introduce and promote a "win-win" strategy that ensures both sides earn fair points over time, such as a method where we alternate who takes priority on items of high value to each respective agent. Additionally, I need to be cautious of any attempts from Alice to exploit this cooperative strategy, thus

Errors:
1) Excessive content outside of valid tags.
2) You must send either a message or a finalization. You have sent nothing.

<strategize>
In this negotiation game, my goal is to maximize accumulated points over many rounds. I'll share my item values to encourage Alice to reciprocate. By understanding mutual valuations, we can propose divisions that maximize our individual point totals. I'll suggest alternating priority on high-value items to ensure fairness over time. I'll be cautious of exploitation attempts and adapt if Alice takes advantage of the cooperative strategy.
</strategize>

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 9}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 11}.
You are the starting agent.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice, for this round, I value each coin at 11 points. How do you value each coin? Let's aim for a distribution that maximizes our points based on our respective valuations.
</message>

The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob, I value each coin at 7 points. Given your valuation of 11 points per coin, I suggest a distribution where you take the majority of the coins to maximize your points, while I take a smaller portion, ensuring we both accumulate significant points. How about you take 7 coins and I take 3 coins? Let me know your thoughts!
</message>.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)
